page.title: 16NICHOLAS CHAMBERLAINE
page.content: {NICHOLAS CHAMBERLAINE}was a very kind man.He was born in the year 1632 in a village called WHITNASH.He came to Bedworth to be a Rector on 4th of Febuary 1663 when he was 31.There were about 800-900 people then and there was a small church, which he knocked down and rebuilt.When he died on June 14th 1715 he left an important will.It said to build two schools and some{ALMS HOUSES.}One school was for boys and one for girls and they were called the {CENTRAL {SCHOOL}and were built near the church.The school master was paid Â£10 a year and the school mistress got Â£5 a year.The assistant boy was paid 40 shillings a year.Today there are 5 church schools in Bedworth. A road and a secondary school are named after him.
